counterfit.core.state.CFState¶

class CFState[source]¶

Bases: object

Singleton class responsible for managing targets and attacks. Instantiation of a class is restricted to one object.

Methods

add_attack_to_target

After a CFAttack object has been built, add it to the target for tracking.

add_framework

Adds a framework to Counterfit.

add_target

Add a target to Counterfit

build_new_attack

Build a new CFAttack.

get_active_target

Get the active target

get_attacks

Get all available attacks

get_frameworks

Get all available frameworks

import_frameworks

Imports the available frameworks from the frameworks folder.

import_targets

Imports available targets from the targets folder.

list_targets

Get a list of targets

load_framework

Load a framework by name.

load_target

Load a target by name.

reload_framework

Reimports the framework.

reload_target

Reloads the active target.

run_attack

Run a prepared attack.

set_active_target

Set the active target with the target name provided.

state

Static method to fetch the current instance.
add_attack_to_target(target_name: str, cfattack: counterfit.core.attacks.CFAttack) → None[source]¶

After a CFAttack object has been built, add it to the target for tracking.

Parameters

  • target_name (str) – The target name

  • cfattack (CFAttack) – The CFAttack object to add.

add_framework(framework_name: str, framework: Optional[counterfit.core.frameworks.Framework] = None) → None[source]¶

Adds a framework to Counterfit.

Parameters

  • framework_name (str) – Name of the framework

  • framework (Framework, optional) – The Framework object to add. Defaults to None.

add_target(target_name: str, target: Optional[counterfit.core.targets.Target] = None)[source]¶

Add a target to Counterfit

Parameters

  • target_name (str) – The name of the target

  • target (Target, optional) – The Target object to add. Defaults to None.

build_new_attack(target_name: str, attack_name: str, scan_id: Optional[str] = None) → counterfit.core.attacks.CFAttack[source]¶

Build a new CFAttack. Search through the loaded frameworks for the attack and create a new CFAttack object for use.

Parameters

  • target_name (str, required) – The target name.

  • attack_name (str, required) – The attack name.

  • scan_id (str, Optional) – A unique value

Returns

A new CFAttack object.

Return type

CFAttack

get_active_target() → counterfit.core.targets.Target[source]¶

Get the active target

Returns

The active target.

Return type

Target

get_attacks() → dict[source]¶

Get all available attacks

Returns

all available attacks from all frameworks.

Return type

dict

get_frameworks() → dict[source]¶

Get all available frameworks

Parameters

None –

Returns

all frameworks.

Return type

dict

import_frameworks(frameworks_path: str) → None[source]¶

Imports the available frameworks from the frameworks folder. Adds the loaded frameworks into self.frameworks. Frameworks contain the methods required for managing the attacks that are found within the framework.

Parameters

frameworks_path (str) – A folder path where frameworks are kept.

import_targets(targets_path: str) → None[source]¶

Imports available targets from the targets folder. Adds the loaded frameworks to CFState.targets. Targets contain the data and methods to interact with a target machine learning system.

Parameters

targets_path (str) – Folder path to where targets are kept

list_targets() → list[source]¶

Get a list of targets

Returns

A list of imported targets

Return type

list

load_framework(framework: str, force_no_config: bool = False) → None[source]¶

Load a framework by name. By loading a framework, the attacks under the framework are loaded and ready for use. Attacks are not loaded during import_frameworks as loading could be slow, or a particular framework could cause errors and prevent all frameworks from loading.

Parameters

  • framework (str) – The framework name

  • force_no_config (bool, optional) – [description]. Defaults to False.

load_target(target: str) → counterfit.core.targets.Target[source]¶

Load a target by name. Targets are not loaded during import to prevent loading unnecessary targets during a session. This function calls target.load().

Parameters

name (The target) –

Returns

None

reload_framework(framework_name)[source]¶

Reimports the framework.

Parameters

framework_name (str) – framework to reload

reload_target()[source]¶

Reloads the active target.

run_attack(target_name: str, attack_id: str) → bool[source]¶

Run a prepared attack. Get the appropriate framework and execute the attack.

Parameters

attack_id (str, required) – The attack id to run.

Returns

A new Attack object with an updated cfattack_class. Additional properties set in this function include, attack_id (str) and the parent framework (str). The framework string is added to prevent the duplication of code in run_attack.

Return type

Attack

set_active_target(target: counterfit.core.targets.Target) → None[source]¶

Set the active target with the target name provided.

Parameters

target (Target) – The target object to set as the active target

static state()[source]¶

Static method to fetch the current instance.
